DOC.brief_summary: The primary aim study examine beneficial effect two novel treatment Gulf War Veteran 's Illness ( Tai Chi Wellness intervention ) establish efficacy mind-body approach symptom reduction .
DOC.detailed_description: Objectives : Over 40,000 Veterans serve 1991 Gulf War ( GW ) persistent form chronic multisymptom illness defines Gulf War Veterans Illness ( GWVI ) . With exist proven treatment provide relief sufferer , critical find efficacious acceptable treatment GWVI . The long-term goal develop safe , readily available , mind-body treatment reduce pain chronic symptom enhance wellness Veterans GWVI . Tai Chi traditional Chinese mind-body therapy practice century . In last decade , investigator demonstrate Tai Chi improve physical health psychological wellbeing patient variety chronic condition . The propose randomize trial establish effectiveness Tai Chi mind-body treatment Veterans GWVI . One hundred twenty participant meet criterion GWVI randomly assign either Tai Chi exercise stretch wellness education group 12 week post treatment assessment , follow-up assessment . The investigator accomplish follow Specific Aims : Specific Aim 1 : Evaluate whether Tai Chi intervention reduce symptom pain Veterans GWVI Wellness intervention . The investigator hypothesize participant randomize Tai Chi intervention show great reduction pain symptom Wellness intervention maintain change 9-month follow-up period . Specific Aim 2 : Evaluate whether Tai Chi intervention improve fatigue , cognition , quality life , physical functioning GW Veterans GWVI , compare Wellness intervention . The investigator hypothesize participant randomize Tai Chi intervention evidence improvement fatigue , cognitive functioning , quality life , physical functioning randomize Wellness intervention maintain change 9-month follow-up period . Research Design : One hundred twenty GW Veterans meeting criterion GWVI randomly assign either Tai Chi Condition Wellness Condition , half condition . Methodology : All participant receive 12 week randomly-assigned intervention twice week . Participants condition receive assessment baseline , 12 week ( post-intervention ) , 24 week ( 3 month post-intervention ) 48 week ( 9 month post-intervention ) . Assessments include instrument measure self-reported pain , fatigue , cognition , quality life , physical functioning .
DOC.criteria: Male female Veterans age 40 year old Served 1991 Gulf War Meets criteria chronic multisymptom illness ( CMI ) base CDC criteria32 characterize one symptom least 6 month duration least two three symptom category : musculoskeletal pain ( muscle pain , joint pain , stiffness ) fatigue moodcognition . One symptom CMI must musculoskeletal joint pain stiffness least 6 month duration ( addition fatigue cognitive complaint CDC criteria32 ) Willing abstain initiate participation another formalized exercise program completion study Ability pass Physical Activity Readiness Questionnaire ( PARQ ) , 5item measure use help ensure safe participant exercise Not plan relocate next 3 month Lacks capacity provide consent Diagnosed major medical neurological disorder , e.g. , diabetes neurologic disorder cancer chronic infectious disease liver disease Or moderate severe traumatic brain injury , could otherwise explain health symptom interfere ability safely engage Tai Chi exercise Change psychotropic pain medication past month This minimize amount symptom change due medication alteration Once enrol , medication change nonetheless expect monitor Regular current Tai Chi , mindfulness , yoga practice , define 15 minute per day least 3 7 day per week one month Veterans prior experience currently engage regular practice level eligible High risk mental health perspective evidence psychiatrically hospitalize enter drug alcohol detoxification rehabilitation program , attempt suicide within previous 2 year current active suicidal ideation Pregnant breastfeeding plan become pregnant within year Enrollment pregnant breastfeeding participant could potentially complicate outcome , new symptom likely arise course intervention attributable pregnancy breastfeed intervention symptom relate GWVI
